oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1955-11-19 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 19, 1955. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performers the Carter Sisters with Mother Maybelle (although the Louvin Brothers were advertised as the guests for this week on the previous show), and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Moon Mullican, Minnie Pearl, Grandpa Jones, Tommy Jackson, and Lew Childre. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Moon Mullican; Minnie Pearl; Carter Sisters; Maybelle Carter; Grandpa Jones; Ernest Tubb; Tommy Jackson; Lew Childre
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: I'll Sail My Ship Alone (Moon Mullican) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Carter Sisters and Mother Maybelle -- The Yellow Rose Of Texas (Carter Sisters, Mother Maybelle) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Grandpa Jones -- Walking In My Sleep (Grandpa Jones) -- Grant Turner talks -- Ernest Tubb talks -- Letters Have No Arms (Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tommy Jackson and Lew Childre -- Soldier's Joy (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Lew Childre calls) -- Closing statement (Ernest Tubb) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Byrd, Billy; Brasfield, Rod; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Minnie Pearl; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Mullican, Moon, 1909-1967; Carter Sisters; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Carter, Maybelle, 1909-1978
